lines.text: I can't talk without thinking, not being a lawyer.
There ain't no right for us poor people than the end of a gun.
Tell me, is it more important for you to kill a man than to save an innocent one.
Now read it back to me, Roy.
"If we are ever going to have law and order in this part of the country, we got to take vipers like those Fords and that slimy railroad detective Runyon and shoot 'em down like dogs."
Are you coming out or am I coming in?

Prepare for the vengeance of the Lord! The day of reckoning is mighty close and you'll catch a heapin' fire if you don't get to repentin' and get to it quick! Hellfire is awaitin' ya. Are you ready to meet your Maker?

You willing to stand before the judgmency with a chaw of tobacco in your mouth? Lost souls, that's what you are! Black as sin! Black with iniquity! The light of the Lord ain't in any of ya! Do you ever think of salvation? Do you ever think of the kingdom? No! All you ever think of is your bellies... and your corn pone and you chitlins and your corn liquor. Ah, brother, how about a swig of that jug?
No danger. The Fords only shoot at backs.

[Holding a gun]
Now lay there still. Don't let me hear a peep from ya!
You won't hear nothing from me, brother. I wanna be around for breakfast!
Pinky never so much as even stole a chicken in his whole life!
